From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>

"You can't reach him because your link was broken when I removed your spark
from his old body." he figured that was a logical assumption to tell her.
"Now you will just have to stop worrying about him for a while and start
thinking about yourself. You have a very unexpected form and will need time
to adjust. Lunarpine is a bigbot that can take care of himself."

Veratis studied the readings he'd been taking the whole time she was
forming. He set down the results he'd found, turned to her looked her
directly in the eyes. "Lunarpine promised he'd return for you. I think he'd
crawl on his belly if he had to. Any bot who'd risk his own existence to
carry two sparks isn't one to give up easily. He'll be back."
----- Original Message -----
From: <logomorph@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 31, 2000 6:05 AM
Subject: Re: Veratis


> Shadow Wing::
>
> She looked at Veratis. She could feel her form moving and changing.
> It was about 60% complete.  Her body was was becoming covered with
> soft, white fur. Her wings were growing and were a soft gray that
> lighted up to white at the tips.  She stood there wondering why
> Lunarpine hadn't come back for her. She leaned against the table and
> closed her eyes. She tried to picture in her mind where Lunarpine
> was. She could almost feel his presence, but not see him.  She tried
> to hear his thoughts, but couldn't.  She sighed and lowered her
> head. "I can not find him. I don't know why, but I can't connect with
> him." She looked up at Veratis, sorrow was in her eyes.
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Veratis stared at the form before him. It was large and powerful.
> The best
> > part was that it still wasn't completely finished. "Shadow Wing you
> are
> > truly becoming a beautiful creature. So graceful yet so powerfull."
> He was
> > still astonished at what she turned out to be. "Lunarpine still
> hasn't
> > returned and I can't communicate with him." He was wondering if her
> > telepathy was still there or if it had stopped with her
> completion." Do not
> > worry my dear, everything will be fine.
> >
>
>
>
>
>
